intro: Cinchona macrocalyx var. uritusinga, commonly known as the Uritusonga quinine tree, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers and dark, glossy leaves. The plant is notable for its potential medicinal properties, particularly due to the presence of alkaloids similar to quinine. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments at higher elevations. Its botanical significance lies in its role in traditional medicine and its genetic relationship to other cinchona species used for producing antimalarial drugs.
